    • startt

      public void startt() throws ExitProgram, ServerUnavailableException, java.io.IOException
      Description copied from interface: AbaloneClientView
      Asks for user input continuously and handles communication accordingly using the AbaloneClientView.handleUserInput(String input) method. If an ExitProgram exception is thrown, stop asking for input, send an exit message to the server according to the protocol and close the connection.
      Specified by:
      startt in interface AbaloneClientView
      Throws:
      ServerUnavailableException - in case of IO exceptions.
      java.io.IOException
      ExitProgram

    • handleServerCommand

      public void handleServerCommand​(java.lang.String input)

    • handleUserInput

      public void handleUserInput​(java.lang.String input) throws ExitProgram, ServerUnavailableException, java.io.IOException
      Description copied from interface: AbaloneClientView
      Split the user input on a ":" and handle it accordingly. - If the input is valid, take the corresponding action (for example, when "create:room:2" is called, send a createRoom()) - If the input is invalid, show a message to the user and print the help menu.
      Specified by:
      handleUserInput in interface AbaloneClientView
      Parameters:
      input - The user input.
      Throws:
      ExitProgram - When the user has indicated to exit the program.
      ServerUnavailableException - if an IO error occurs in taking the corresponding actions.
      java.io.IOException

    • getIp

      public java.net.InetAddress getIp() throws java.net.UnknownHostException
      Description copied from interface: AbaloneClientView
      Ask the user to input a valid IP. If it is not valid, show a message and ask again.
      Specified by:
      getIp in interface AbaloneClientView
      Returns:
